intro: Xylosma sanctae-annae, commonly known as the sacred annunciation xylosma, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that split open to release seeds. Xylosma sanctae-annae is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
